extName.description: The extension name may translate easily from 'Color Pick Eyedropper' however it is preferred to leave it english unless your locale has a matching translation for eyedropper, color, and pick.  If you can omit the space between Color and Pick in your language then please do so.  Eyedropper referrs to what the tool would be called in image editing software such as photoshop in your locale.  Definitions follow: color - the property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way the object reflects or emits light.  pick -  choose (someone or something) from a number of alternatives, typically after careful thought.  eyedropper - a short glass tube with a rubber bulb at one end and a tiny hole at the other, for measuring out drops of medicine or other liquids, (also eyedropper tool) (in image-editing software) a function enabling the user to copy color from any part of an image.

extDescription.message: A zoomed eyedropper & color chooser tool that allows you to select color values from webpages and more.

closeAndExit.message: Close and Exit Color Pick Mode

hideMinimize.description: This will hide the extension's popup menu triggered when clicking the extension icon, the [esc] key does this too.

pickAgainLocked.description: Pick Another Color, the [Enter] keyboard key does this too.

disablePickEveryTime.message: Do not start picking each time popup is clicked
disablePickEveryTime.description: 'start picking' in this usage refers to entering color selection mode.  By default the mode will be retained instead (locked (selected) or unlocked (picking)).  'popup' refers to the extension's popup menu triggered when clicking the icon.

zoomPreviewDefaultTip.message: Drag or use the arrows to pan this view, once it loads.  In the event of a problem loading; alternative modes such as snap mode or tablet mode may be available depending on settings.  If snap mode has been blocked, unblock from settings or click to enable snap mode here.

pickEveryTime.message: Start picking colors each time popup is clicked
pickEveryTime.description: 'Start picking' in this usage refers to entering color selection mode.  If this feature is disabled the previous mode will be retained instead (locked (selected) or unlocked (picking)).  'popup' refers to the extension's popup menu triggered when clicking the icon.

reloadRequired.message: Sorry - the page must be reloaded for this feature of the ColorPick extension to work. This can occcur when the extension updates or is reloaded.

addAllConfirm.message: This will add %history_count% entries to the Palette which already has %palette_count% entries.  Are you sure?

palette_plus_saturation.description: Used in conjunction with half, third, etc to specify a modification to color saturation values in the positive (increasing) direction so that they become more vibrant

palette_minus_saturation.description: Used in conjunction with half, third, etc to specify a modification to color saturation values in the negative (decreasing) direction so that they become less vibrant

palette_plus_darkness.description: Used in conjunction with half, third, etc to specify a modification to color brightness values in the direction of increasing darkness (decreasing brightness)

palette_minus_darkness.description: Used in conjunction with half, third, etc to specify a modification to color brightness values in the direction of decresing darkness (increasing brightness)

half.description: As in 'one half' and to be concatenated with a color related word like tone, saturation or brightness

third.description: As in 'one third' and to be concatenated with a color related word like tone, saturation or brightness

quarter.description: As in 'one quarter' and to be concatenated with a color related word like tone, saturation or brightness

fifth.description: As in 'one fifth' and to be concatenated with a color related word like tone, saturation or brightness

palette_tone_gen_info.message: Depending on the start color selected, optionally add several half tones (one) or another number of colors for each generated hue but different brightness or saturation.  Choices are dynamic depending on the color selected and what direction we may modify it without running out of changes.

palette_complement.description: see the message palette_complement_info for details

palette_analogous.description: see the message palette_analogous_info for details

palette_harmonious.description: see the message palette_harmonious_info for details

palette_contrasting.description: see the message palette_contrasting_info for details

palette_triadic.description: see the message palette_triadic_info for details

palette_splilt_complementary.description: see the message palette_splilt_complementary_info for details

palette_square.description: see the message palette_square_info for details

palette_tetradic_left.description: see the message palette_tetradic_info for details

palette_tetradic_right.description: see the message palette_tetradic_info for details

palette_complement_info.message: The complement for a given color is 180 degrees away and it's opposite on the color wheel.  This is six 30° increments away.  Please note slight precision inaccuracy is possible as we move into and out of the HSV color space, you can work around this by taking the complement of the complementary color.

palette_analogous_info.message: Analogous colors are 2 colors one 30° increment away from the original color.

palette_harmonious_info.message: Harmonious colors are 2 colors two 30° increments away from the original color.

palette_contrasting_info.message: Contrasting colors are 2 colors three 30° increments away from the original color.

palette_triadic_info.message: Triadic colors are 2 colors four 30° increments away from the base color, each four 30° increment from the original color.  The two colors added are also 4 increments away from each other forming an equilateral triangle of color.

palette_splilt_complementary_info.message: Split complementary colors are 2 colors five 30° increments away from the base color, each a single 30° increment from the complementary color.

palette_square_info.message: Square colors are 3 colors each three 30° increments away from the base color, and includes the complementary color.  This forms a perfect square.

palette_tetradic_info.message: Tetradic (Rectangular) include the complementary color, and also two additional colors each two 30° increments away from the base color or its complement in the same direction (clockwise or counterclockwise).  Depending on if Left or Right is selected the increments will be rectangular in one direction or the other.

auto_install_key.message: Click here to Automatically Install this License into your Color Pick Extension
